unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Spark Demand, But Bureaucracy Bites!**
normalised: Energy and Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Spark Demand, But Bureaucracy Bites!

unnormalised: Good news, folks! The Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE) is still offering subsidies for solar rooftop installations, making going green a little easier on the wallet. We're talking serious savings here, potentially slashing your electricity bill and helping you enjoy that Onam Sadhya without worrying about the AC costs!

unnormalised: Reports from Chennai to Chandigarh show a surge in applications. Families are lining up to take advantage of the incentives, hoping to power their homes with sunshine. Think about it, generating your own electricity and maybe even selling the surplus back to the grid!

unnormalised: However, whispers are growing about red tape. Some folks in Kerala are complaining about delays in subsidy disbursement, with reports mentioning hold-ups at the local discom level. Rs. 50,000 subsidy sounding great until you wait months to actually receive it, right?

unnormalised: The MNRE is supposedly working to streamline the process, but as of now, navigating the paperwork can be a bit like untangling a plate of festival sevai. So, do your homework, get all your documents in order, and be prepared for a bit of a wait. Still, with potential savings exceeding Rs. 2 lakhs over the system's lifespan (around 25 years!), it might just be worth the hassle. Let's hope they can iron out the kinks soon – everyone deserves a hassle-free transition to clean energy!
